question.para: There's a new version of package Foo.

answer.para: If the new version is more than a day old, it is likely that someone has tested the release and reported it on the mailing lists. Please search the archives before posting questions about whether it works.

If you'd like to report the new release, follow these steps to avoid making a duplicate report.
Check the freshmeat page for the project to see if it has been updated. If it hasn't, report the release there.
If freshmeat has been updated, check LFS bugzilla (or BLFS bugzilla) to see if the release has been posted there.
If the release is not in bugzilla, report it to lfs-book (or blfs-book for packages in BLFS). And if you like, test it and report any problems or changes in compilation instructions, too.
